Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of rosette in added white outline with added red centres above white and red bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreparts of a bull (head missing and red patches on body and shoulder) to right; part of swastika and pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 259, no. 503, pl. 67)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0491) (phase 2)
